The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Celsia commixta is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
